docs.snippet: Beckham and five other Giants were fined a total of $72,400 for their actions in Sunday’s melee-marred game in St. Louis....

headline.main: Odell Beckham Jr. Among Six Giants Fined Over Rams Game
headline.print_headline: Beckham Is Among Six Giants Fined Over Rams Game

docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; New York Giants rookie receiver Odell Beckham Jr is among six Giants who are fined total of $72,400 for taking part in on-field scuffles during game against St Louis Rams; other football news noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Beckham and five other Giants were fined a total of $72,400 for their actions in Sunday’s melee-marred game in St. Louis.

docs.snippet: Officials have investigated more than 40 threats of violence against officers since two of their colleagues were shot and killed on Saturday....

headline.main: Threats to New York Police Stream In After Fatal Shootings, Putting Department on Edge
headline.print_headline: Threats to Police Stream In After Fatal Shootings, Putting Department on Edge

docs.abstract: Reports of threats against New York City police increase after killing of two officers and Mayor Bill de Blasio's call for vigilance; four arrests are made in connection with threats and two Brooklyn precinct station houses are given extra security.
docs.lead_paragraph: Officials have investigated more than 40 threats of violence against officers since two of their colleagues were shot and killed on Saturday.

docs.snippet: The federal prosecutor’s office, lawyers representing inmates and New York City officials will discuss four key issues, including use of force by guards....

headline.main: Settlement Talks Over Rikers Island Class-Action Lawsuit Are Planned
headline.print_headline: Talks Are Planned in Class-Action Lawsuit Over the Violence at Rikers Island

docs.abstract: Lawyers representing Rikers Island inmates in class action suit will meet with New York City's Law Department for three consecutive days of negotiations; judge grants request by United States attorney in Manhattan to join suit; talks will focus on issues including treatment of adolescent inmates and use of force by guards.
docs.lead_paragraph: The federal prosecutor’s office, lawyers representing inmates and New York City officials will discuss four key issues, including use of force by guards.

docs.snippet: Following a longstanding tradition, Gramercy Park was opened to the public for an hour on Wednesday for Christmas Eve festivities....

headline.main: Inside Gramercy Park’s Gates, One Night Less Silent Than the Other 364
headline.print_headline: Inside Gramercy Gates, One Night Less Silent Than the Other 364

docs.abstract: Sarah Maslin Nir Nocturnalist column; exclusive Gramercy Park opens to public for one hour in traditional Christmas Eve event.
docs.lead_paragraph: Following a longstanding tradition, Gramercy Park was opened to the public for an hour on Wednesday for Christmas Eve festivities.

headline.main: Video: A Shift in Protests After Officers Are Killed

docs.snippet: The legislation would open all of the agency’s meetings, and require its officials to acknowledge that their duty is to the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, not to the governor who appointed them....

headline.main: Cuomo and Christie Silent as Deadline for Port Authority Bill Approaches
headline.print_headline: Cuomo and Christie Silent as Deadline for Port Authority Bill Approaches

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Kate Zernike contributed reporting from New Jersey.

docs.abstract: Neither New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo nor New Jersey Gov Chris Christie have indicated whether they will sign Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Transparency and Accountability Act of 2014, which was unanimously passed by both state's legislatures; bill, which would impose new administrative, financial and ethical requirements on agency controlled by both states, must be approved by both governors in order to pass.
docs.lead_paragraph: The legislation would open all of the agency’s meetings, and require its officials to acknowledge that their duty is to the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, not to the governor who appointed them.

docs.snippet: Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif announced plans early Thursday to set up military courts to deal with terrorism cases after a deadly Taliban attack on a school in Peshawar last week....

headline.main: Pakistani Premier Announces Military Courts for Terrorism Cases
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Premier Announces Military Courts for Terrorism Cases

docs.abstract: Pakistan Prime Min Nawaz Sharif, in first public address since Taliban attack on school in Peshawar, vows to set up military courts for terrorism cases and crush militancy; government will also strengthen existing laws, develop new counterterrorism force and prevent banned groups from operating under different name.
docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif announced plans early Thursday to set up military courts to deal with terrorism cases after a deadly Taliban attack on a school in Peshawar last week.

docs.snippet: The Neapolitan tradition of “suspended coffee” — paying for two, drinking one and leaving the receipt for the other for a stranger — has spread around the world....

headline.main: In Naples, Gift of Coffee to Strangers Never Seen
headline.print_headline: In Naples, Gift of Coffee to Strangers Never Seen

docs.abstract: Neapolitan tradition known as 'suspended coffee,' in which customers pay for two coffees at cafes and leave receipt behind so that a stranger may receive free cup, is being revived both in Naples and around the world; simple act of generosity, which boomed during World War II, seeks to help those stricken by today's hard economic times.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Neapolitan tradition of “suspended coffee” — paying for two, drinking one and leaving the receipt for the other for a stranger — has spread around the world.

docs.snippet: Around the holidays, young players who have recently earned their first big paychecks face pressure to buy gifts for family members, friends and hangers-on....

headline.main: N.B.A. Rookies Carefully Choose Stockings to Fill
headline.print_headline: N.B.A. Rookies Carefully Choose Stockings to Fill

docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column explores pressure NBA rookies face to lavish friends, family and hangers-on with expensive Christmas gifts after earning their first big paychecks.
docs.lead_paragraph: Around the holidays, young players who have recently earned their first big paychecks face pressure to buy gifts for family members, friends and hangers-on.
